text: Prince Souvanna Phouma has not yet replied to the mission, but recent statement made by him in Phnom Penh indicate that he still regards himself as the only legal Prime Minister of Laos. His policy of strict neutrality from 1951 to 1958 kept the kingdom in peace, though at the cost of virtual partition of the country into the pro-communist north and the pro-western centre and south.
handwritten_text: Prince Souvanna Phouma has not yet replied to the mission, but recent statement made by him in Phnom Penh indicate that he still regards himself as the only legal Prime Minister of Laos. His policy of strict neutrality from 1951 to 1958 kept the kingdom in peace, though at the cost of virtual partition of the country into the pro-communist north and the pro-western centre and south.
